alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 301 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ray Point, or four miles north of Oakville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... George West, Three Rivers, Mineral, Tulsita, Karon, Normanna, Oakville, Pettus, Ray Point, Tuleta and Pawnee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 58 and 72. US Highway 281 between mile markers 618 and 632. US Highway 181 between mile markers 572 and 586. US Highway 59 between mile markers 720 and 722. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
